0: A new poll shows that just 26 percent of Americans support Obamacare, but at the same time only 13 percent think the law will be completely repealed. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Associated Press-Gfk survey was completed before the White House announced this week that it had signed up 6 million people for private health plans through the state and federal exchanges under the Affordable Care Act. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The poll showed that 7 in 10 American believe the law will stay on the books with some changes. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The AP noted that support for the law has dropped 13 points since 2010, when 39 percent favored the law. Opposition also has dipped 7 percentage points from 2010, when it stood at 43 percent. The number of people on the fence, the AP reported, has tripled from 10 percent to 30 percent. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The limited support for the law is similar to what the poll found in January and December when it stood at 27 percent.
